Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was left unattended in their pod while engaging in self-
harm.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 04/02/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/03/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated he was on a one staff to one
youth ratio on 03/30/2025 and was not sure if it was with Staff 4 or
another staff. Youth A stated Staff 4 placed him in his room
without issue for bedtime and he placed a towel over his room
door window for privacy to use the bathroom once Staff 4 left the
unit. Youth A stated Staff 2 came to his room door and told him to
take down the towel. Youth A stated he took down the towel and
started to cover his room door window with paper and putty he
pulled from the room door window. Youth A stated Staff 2 came to
his room door again and told him to take the paper off his room
door. Youth A stated he heard rattling of keys later on and pushed
out of his room when either Staff 1, Staff 2 or Staff 3 opened his
room door. Youth A stated Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 tried to
verbally redirect and escort him back into his room. Youth A was
asked to describe how staff tried escorting him. Youth A stated
Staff 1 and Staff 3 held his wrists and tried to walk him back to his
room but Staff 1 and Staff 3 let go of his wrists when he did not
move. Youth A stated Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 stood in front of
him and next to each other like a wall to prevent him from leaving
the corner area. Youth A stated Supervisor came to the unit,
talked with him and he agreed to go back into his room. Youth A
stated he was never left alone on Unit 2A on 03/30/2025 but Staff
4 left before 11:00 PM when his one staff to one youth ratio was
2

supposed to end. Youth A stated he was not injured in this
incident. (Deputy Director’s email dated 04/30/2025 stated Staff 5
was Youth A’s one staff to one youth ratio on 03/30/2025.)
Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated she did not recall who was Youth A’s one
staff to one youth ratio staff on 03/30/2025 but the staff left the unit
around 9:00 PM when Youth A’s constant watch ended. Staff 1
stated Staff 2 came to the unit around 10:15 PM to allow Staff 1 to
write an incident report off the unit. Staff 1 stated she returned to
the unit around 11:00 PM and noticed Youth A’s room door
window covered with paper. Staff 1 stated either Staff 2 or Staff 3,
who arrived on the unit shortly after Staff 1, called for supervisor
assistance to open Youth A’s room door. Staff 1 stated either Staff
2 or Staff 3 opened Youth A’s room door and Staff 1 removed the
paper from the room door window. Staff 1 stated Youth A pushed
past Staff 1 and Staff 3 tried to block Youth A from exiting his
room. Staff 1 stated Youth A stood in the corner of the common
area by his room and refused to step back into his room. Staff 1
stated Supervisor arrived on the unit and spoke with Youth A and
Staff 1 left the unit.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was the only staff on the unit
when she arrived to relieve Staff 1 to write an incident report,
which is done off the unit. Staff 2 stated Youth A covered his room
door window with a towel when Staff 1 left the unit. Staff 2 stated
she redirected Youth A to take the towel down and he refused but
the towel fell down. Staff 2 stated she used the restroom on the
unit and she accidentally left the unit keys in the locked restroom.
Staff 2 stated she called Supervisor about her keys but did not get
a response. Staff 2 stated she called master control to open Youth
A’s room door once it was covered with paper but master control
refused without supervisor approval. Staff 2 stated she continued
to check on Youth A. Staff 2 stated Youth A managed to pull his
room monitoring sheet positioned in the edge of his door frame
and door and ripped it up. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 returned to the unit
with Staff 3, who arrived for midnight shift. Staff 2 stated Staff 1
opened Youth A’s room door because they could not see into his
room. Staff 2 stated Youth A exited his room and Staff 3 blocked
Youth A from moving further into the common area. Staff 2 stated
she and Staff 3 verbally redirected and tried to escort Youth A
back into his room. Staff 2 stated Supervisor came to the unit and
she and Staff 1 left the unit when Supervisor spoke with Youth A.
Staff 2 was asked if she retrieved her keys from the restroom and
she did not recall. Staff 2 was asked about Youth A’s one staff to
3

one youth ratio. Staff 2 stated she did not recall which staff was
assigned as Youth A’s one staff to one youth ratio but the staff left
around 9:00 PM.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 3 stated she immediately noticed Youth A’s room
door was covered when she arrived on Unit 2D around 11:00 PM
on 03/30/2025. Staff 3 stated she could not see into Youth A’s
room and asked Staff 1 and Staff 2 if they called for a supervisor.
Staff 3 stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 told her a call was made and they
were waiting for Supervisor to arrive to open Youth A’s room door
because it was sleeping hours. Staff 3 stated she did some
paperwork at the staff desk and called the supervisor twice before
Staff 1 opened Youth A’s room door. Staff 3 stated Youth A
pushed past Staff 1 and stood in the common area corner by his
room. Staff 3 stated she and Staff 1 tried to verbally redirect and
guide Youth A back into his room when Youth A refused to return
to his room. Staff 3 stated she and Staff 1 stood in front of Youth A
and talked with Youth A in the corner until Supervisor arrived.
Staff 3 stated Supervisor coaxed Youth A back into his room
without incident. Staff 3 stated she did not recall Staff 2’s
involvement in this incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 4 stated she did not work on 03/30/2025.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 5 stated she is a morning shift staff but has
worked overtime with Youth A as his one staff to one youth ratio.
Staff 5 stated she did not recall if she worked with Youth A on
03/30/2025 and what time she would have left but Youth A’s
constant watch either ended at 9:00 PM or 11:00 PM. Staff 5
stated she is required to call an on-duty supervisor for
confirmation and approval to leave whether it was 9:00 PM or
11:00 PM.
Supervisor was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor stated Youth A was outside of his
room in a corner with Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 when he arrived
on Unit 2D for a supervisor assistance call. Supervisor stated he
de-escalated Youth A and Youth A returned to his room without
incident. Supervisor was asked about Youth A’s one staff to one
youth status. Supervisor stated Youth A’s one staff to one youth
ratio end time fluctuated between 9:00 PM or 11:00 PM and he
learned the next day that Youth A was supposed to be on a one
staff to one youth ratio until 11:00 PM on 03/30/2025. Supervisor
4

stated his email address is not part of Wayne County Juvenile
Detention’s management group and he did not receive email
notification that Youth A’s one staff to one youth ended at 11:00
PM. Supervisor was asked about Staff 2 locking the unit keys in
the staff restroom. Supervisor stated he does not recall Staff 2
reporting her keys were locked in the staff restroom.
Video
Unit 2D video on 03/30/2025 at 10:00 PM shows all youths are
inside their rooms. Staff 1 leaves the unit at 10:11 PM. Staff 2
enters the staff bathroom at 10:12 PM and exits at 10:14 PM.
Youth A covers his room door. Staff 2 walks to Youth A’s room at
10:16 PM, 10:17 PM, 10:18 PM and 10:19 PM. Staff 2 uses her
walkie talkie at Youth A’s room door at 10:22 PM. Staff 2 sits
down at the staff desk. Youth A removes his towel and rehangs it
at 10:32 PM. Staff 1 goes to Youth A’s room door at 10:37 PM and
10:48 PM. Youth A takes down the towel and starts to cover his
room door window with paper. Staff 1 returns to the unit at 10:54
PM. Staff 1 goes to Youth A’s room at 10:57 PM. Youth A’s room
door window is fully covered with paper by 10:59 PM. Staff 1
leaves the unit at 11:02 PM. Staff 1 returns to the unit with Staff 3
at 11:08 PM. Staff 1 hands keys to Staff 2. Staff 2 enters and exits
the staff bathroom at 11:11 PM and gives keys to Staff 1. Staff 1
walks to Youth A’s room and opens the door. Youth A exits his
room. Staff 1 takes down the paper down from Youth A’s room
door. Staff 3 and Youth A are in the corner by Youth A’s room.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempt to escort Youth A to his room but Youth
A resists and flails his arms. Staff 1 and Staff 3 allow Youth A to
stand freely in the corner. Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 stand in front
of Youth A. Supervisor arrives on the unit and talks with Youth A
at 11:15 PM. Youth A is in his room with the door closed at 11:30
PM.
Documentation
Deputy Director on 04/17/2025 showed an email on his computer
dated 03/28/2025 to this Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Consultant. Email states Youth A is on constant watch from 8:00
AM to 11:00 PM from 03/19/2025 to 04/01/2025. The email is
addressed to a group that includes Supervisor.
03/30/2025 Unit 2D afternoon shift logbook was reviewed for
information relevant to this investigation.
3:00 PM Staff 1 and Staff 5 are on the unit with four youths. One
set of keys is received for Staff 1 and Staff 5.
9:00 PM Staff 5 writes youths are secured in their rooms.
9:24 PM Staff 5 writes Staff 1 is off the unit.
5

9:45 PM Staff 1 writes about checking on the youths.
10:15 PM Staff 2 writes she relieves Staff 1. Staff 2 writes about
calling a supervisor because Youth A has towel over his door
window.
10:20 PM Staff 2 writes she requests master control to open
Youth A’s room door but told a supervisor must give permission.
Staff 2 writes she requests Youth A to take down the towel from
his door.
10:30 PM Staff 2 writes she requests Youth A to take down the
towel from his door.
10:37 PM Staff 2 writes Youth A pulls his room monitoring form
into his room and tears it up. Staff 2 writes Youth A still has a
towel over his room door window.
11:05 PM Staff 1 writes Youth A refuses to take paper down from
his room door. Staff 1 writes waiting for staff relief to end shift.
Staff 3 signs in for the shift and writes Youth A’s room door is
covered.
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 wrote incident reports that coincided
with their interviews.
Staff 1 was hired in 05/2025. Staff 1 attended Handle with Care
training on 05/29/2024, 05/30/2024 and 07/03/2024.
Staff 2 was hired in 06/2007. Staff 1 attended Handle with Care
training on 01/16/2024 and 07/03/2024.
Staff 3 was hired in 04/2024. Staff 3 attended Handle with Care
training on 04/24/2024, 04/25/2024 and 07/03/2024.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 2D one steps into the common area with the
staff desk area directly in front. The staff restroom is located
between the two parallel desk counters that form the staff desk
area. Room 11, Youth A’s room, is on the opposite side of the
common area and slightly to the right. To the right of Youth A’s
room is an alcove where Youth A is positioned with Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3 and Supervisor in this incident before returning to his
room.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A because Youth A was on a
one staff to one youth ratio on 03/30/2025 until 11:00 PM but his
staff left before 11:00 PM and Supervisor did not know Youth A
was on a one staff to one youth ratio until 11:00 PM. In addition,
Staff 2 locked her keys in Unit 2D’s staff restroom on 03/30/2025,
6

which left her without immediate, emergency access to a youth’s
room.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Logbook documentation indicates Staff 2 called for supervisor
assistance at 10:15 PM. Video shows Supervisor is on Unit 2D at
11:15 PM. It cannot be confirmed if Staff 2 actually called
Supervisor at 10:15 PM. Supervisor response time of
approximately an hour is deemed lengthy.
CONSULTATION
Logbook entries should state staff arrival time and departure time
on the unit. 03/30/2025 logbook entries do not state when Staff 1
returned to the unit after writing an incident report or when Staff 5
left the unit at the end of her one staff to one youth shift.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/03/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated he pushed out of his room
when his room door was opened. Youth A stated Staff 1, Staff 2
and Staff 3 tried to redirect him back into his room but he did not
comply until Supervisor came to the unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated either Staff 2 or Staff 3 called for
supervisor assistance to open Youth A’s room door. Staff 1 stated
Staff 2 or Staff 3 opened Youth A’s room door prior to Supervisor
arriving on the unit.
7

Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 opened Youth A’s room door
because Youth A’s room door was covered with paper and they
could not see into the room. Staff 2 stated she did not think it was
best to continue waiting for a supervisor due to Youth A’s self-
harm history.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 told her that a
supervisor was called and they were waiting for a supervisor to
arrive to open Youth A’ room door. Staff 3 stated she did some
paperwork at the staff desk and called the supervisor twice before
Staff 1 opened Youth A’s room door without the presence of a
supervisor.
Supervisor was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor stated Youth A was outside of his
room in the corner with Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 when he arrived
on Unit 2D for a supervisor assistance call. Supervisor stated he
was surprised because staff are not permitted to open a youth’s
room door after 9:00 PM without the presence of a supervisor and
the supervisor is to open the youth’s room door. Supervisor stated
he did not recall receiving multiple calls for this incident.
Video
Unit 2D video on 03/30/2025 video was reviewed. Video does not
record sound.
10:22 PM Staff 2 uses her walkie talkie at Youth A’s room door.
11:15 PM Supervisor arrives on Unit 2D and talks with Youth A.
Documentation
03/30/2025 Unit 2D logbook was reviewed for information relevant
to this additional finding.
10:15 PM Staff 2 writes she relieves Staff 1. Staff 2 writes about
calling a supervisor because Youth A has towel over his door
window.
11:05 PM Staff 1 writes Youth A refuses to take paper down from
his room door. Staff 1 writes waiting for staff relief to end shift.
Staff 3 signs in for the shift and writes Youth A’s room door is
covered.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Youth Movement and
Supervision policy and procedure 10.24 item 3 and item 5 are
relevant to this investigation.
8

Item 3 states “If there is a disturbance or situation requiring JDS
intervention while a resident is in their room, there shall be a
minimum of two (2) JDS’s (when applicable, one must be a JDS
Supervisor) present before unlocking and or entering the room.”
Item 5 states “During normal sleeping hours, resident are
restricted to their bedrooms. Unlocking of a bedroom door,
releasing or entering an occupied room requires the presence and
approval of the JDS Supervisor. Release may only be granted for
extraordinary reason (i.e. illness, etc.) Two (2) JDS’ must be
present (when applicable, one must be a JDS Supervisor) if a
resident is allowed out of his/her bedroom during sleeping hours.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of their Youth Movement
and Supervision policy and procedure when Youth A’s room door
was opened on 03/30/2025 during sleeping hours without the
presence of a supervisor.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
